timeline.bodyText: Have you manually verified that this works as intended? Just not sure whether returning undefined might provide the intended effect.
timeline.author: madanalogy
timeline.diffHunk: @@ -5,7 +5,7 @@ Recommended length for the response: - +

replies.bodyText: Yup it works. But I will change it to use '' instead for better clarity
replies.author: ccyccyccy

timeline.bodyText:
toFixed has a weakness in that it can add unnecessary 0s (e.g. 1 becomes 1.00, as you see how the snapshots change). Depending on the use case, it may be fine, but here we're talking about display so it's an issue.
This situation calls more for multiply by 100, Math.round, and divide by 100.
timeline.author: wkurniawan07

replies.bodyText:
This situation calls more for multiply by 100, Math.round, and divide by 100.

Wow thanks for the suggestion!
replies.author: ccyccyccy

timeline.bodyText:
I don't think this is the right fix.
Somewhere in the code there is a logic such that if responseDetails.answers is initialized for the first time, it will be padded with zeroes. That's what needs to be changed.
timeline.author: wkurniawan07
timeline.diffHunk: @@ -4,7 +4,7 @@

replies.bodyText: It is padded with zeroes due to the submission parameters requiring 0s in the model. Otherwise the half-filled array would fail the model submission when the user clicks save. I couldn't find any way to intercept the process between the user clicking save and actually submitting to server to change the value right before the actual submission. I could change the backend to accept null values though.
replies.author: ccyccyccy

replies.bodyText: The 0's is not padded. It is placeholder to enable you update the second/thrid/... option.
replies.author: xpdavid

replies.bodyText: @xpdavid so what do you suggest we do here? Or is the fix proposed here sufficient?
replies.author: wkurniawan07
xpdavid

replies.bodyText: That variable is for rank recipients question though, although the purpose do otherwise fit
replies.author: wkurniawan07

replies.bodyText:
Keep the current logic, add a check for RANK_RECIPIENTS_ANSWER_NOT_SUBMITTED and display it as empty string also.

I don't understand how this is better. Where would this check happen? Similar to [ngModel]="responseDetails.answers[i] || ''" except that it is now [ngModel]="responseDetails.answers[i] === RANK_RECIPIENTS_ANSWER_NOT_SUBMITTED ? responseDetails.answers[i] : ''"?
replies.author: ccyccyccy

replies.bodyText:
Sorry for the confusion. There are several things here.

0 is a valid answer so it should not be displayed as '' (I might be wrong of this)
Therefore, we should only display *_NOT_SUBMITTED as empty string for input box
RANK_CONSTANT_ANSWER_NOT_SUBMITTED is not zero and is a special value (try search it in the code base).
replies.author: xpdavid

replies.bodyText: @xpdavid I hate to be the bearer of bad news, but the back-end doesn't have any special treatment for that kind of value for constant sum question type. It does have for rank question, but this is not what the issue at hand is.
replies.author: wkurniawan07

replies.bodyText:
Understood. However, if we want to achieve the behavior of having empty string displayed when user does not touch the box, we will need a special value here.
I think it needs more discussion on how do we want to achieve the behavior. Can we remove the commit and continue with other commits on this PR.
replies.author: xpdavid

timeline.bodyText:
Similarly, I don't think this is not the right fix.
The cause is recommendedLength defaults to 0 in all the default data structures. It should default to undefined. You may need to indicate the field as @Nullable in the back-end such that the API output is marked as nullable.
timeline.author: wkurniawan07
timeline.diffHunk: @@ -5,7 +5,7 @@ Recommended length for the response: - +

timeline.message: Change default value of recommendedLength for text questions to be undefined instead of 0
Change default value of recommendedLength for text questions to be undefined instead of 0

timeline.bodyText: Let's take this time to also fix the validation logic: recommendedLength should always be more than 0, because recommendedLength = 0 doesn't make sense.
timeline.author: wkurniawan07

timeline.message: Change default value of recommendedLength for text questions to be undefined instead of 0

timeline.author: xpdavid
xpdavid

timeline.bodyText: Just a note. This will change the things stored in database (should be backward-compatible though)
timeline.author: xpdavid

replies.bodyText: I added this line if (recommendedLength != null && recommendedLength < 1) which would make all forms using the previous default value show an error if they tried to save. Would this be an issue?
replies.author: ccyccyccy

replies.bodyText: This is fine as the frontend is bundled with the backend in production.
replies.author: xpdavid

replies.bodyText: This should be backward compatible because it's equivalent to removing a field. If it's adding a field then we need to worry.
replies.author: wkurniawan07

Set floating point calculation for statistics table to 2dp
Show integers without dp, truncate fractions to 2dp
